model_solution:
Step 1: We need to perform matrix multiplication, so we will multiply the first row of the matrix by the column vector.

\[\begin{pmatrix} 0 & 2 & -1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} (0)(3) + (2)(2) + (-1)(2) \end{pmatrix}\]
Step 2: Evaluate the expression to obtain the first entry of the resulting column vector.

\[\begin{pmatrix} (0)(3) + (2)(2) + (-1)(2) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 + 4 - 2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 \end{pmatrix}\]
Step 3: We need to perform matrix multiplication, so we will multiply the second row of the matrix by the column vector.

\[\begin{pmatrix} 3 & 0 & -3 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} (3)(3) + (0)(2) + (-3)(2) \end{pmatrix}\]
Step 4: Evaluate the expression to obtain the second entry of the resulting column vector.

\[\begin{pmatrix} (3)(3) + (0)(2) + (-3)(2) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 9 + 0 - 6 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 \end{pmatrix}\]
Step 5: 
\[\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 4 & -5 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} (1)(3) + (4)(2) + (-5)(2) \end{pmatrix}\]
\[\begin{pmatrix} (1)(3) + (4)(2) + (-5)(2) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 + 8 - 10 \end{pmatrix}\]
Evaluate the expression to obtain the third entry of the resulting column vector.
\(\begin{pmatrix} 3 + 8 - 10 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 \end{pmatrix}\)
Assemble the resulting entries into a column vector.
\[\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\]
The dot product of the first row of the matrix and the column vector is $\begin{pmatrix} 2 \end{pmatrix}.$
Step 6: The dot product of the second row of the matrix and the column vector is $\begin{pmatrix} 3 \end{pmatrix}.$

full_steps:
Step 1: We need to perform matrix multiplication, so we will multiply the first row of the matrix by the column vector.

\[\begin{pmatrix} 0 & 2 & -1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} (0)(3) + (2)(2) + (-1)(2) \end{pmatrix}\]

Step 2: Evaluate the expression to obtain the first entry of the resulting column vector.

\[\begin{pmatrix} (0)(3) + (2)(2) + (-1)(2) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 + 4 - 2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 \end{pmatrix}\]

Step 3: We need to perform matrix multiplication, so we will multiply the second row of the matrix by the column vector.

\[\begin{pmatrix} 3 & 0 & -3 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} (3)(3) + (0)(2) + (-3)(2) \end{pmatrix}\]

Step 4: Evaluate the expression to obtain the second entry of the resulting column vector.

\[\begin{pmatrix} (3)(3) + (0)(2) + (-3)(2) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 9 + 0 - 6 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 \end{pmatrix}\]

Evaluate the expression to obtain the third entry of the resulting column vector.
\(\begin{pmatrix} 3 + 8 - 10 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 \end{pmatrix}\)

Assemble the resulting entries into a column vector.
\[\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\]
The dot product of the first row of the matrix and the column vector is $\begin{pmatrix} 2 \end{pmatrix}.$
Step 6: The dot product of the second row of the matrix and the column vector is $\begin{pmatrix} 3 \end{pmatrix}.$
